node.title: Victoria investigating seven COVID cases linked to possible Omicron exposure
node.alt: A couple walking in Melbourne's CBD.
node.description: Genomic sequencing is underway for around 30 COVID-positive people who are suspected to have the Omicron variant of the virus, as Victoria records another 1,622 new infections and nine deaths.
node.content:
["Authorities are investigating seven COVID-19 cases that may be linked to\u00a0potential Omicron exposure\u00a0at two Melbourne bars last Friday night.", "The state has recorded 1,622\u00a0new COVID-19 cases and nine\u00a0deaths.", "It is the state's highest daily case count since late October.", "The jump in infections comes amid concern for more than 700 people who attended the Sircuit and Peel Hotel nightclubs in Melbourne's inner north at the weekend with a person who later tested positive to the Omicron variant.", "\"Public health authorities are investigating seven confirmed COVID-19 cases that may be linked to the Peel Hotel and Sircuit Bar sites,\" the health department said on Thursday afternoon.", "\"Work is underway to determine if any of these cases have the Omicron variant.\"", "There have now been 13 confirmed cases of Omicron in Victoria, including a further three international arrivals confirmed on Thursday afternoon.", "The three had all been in quarantine since arriving in the country.", "Genomic sequencing is underway for about 30 other people with COVID-19 who are suspected to have the new strain.", "
Hospitalisations on the rise
", "There are now 12,252\u00a0active cases of the virus in Victoria, and 617\u00a0people have died during the current outbreak.", "There are 384\u00a0people in hospital with the virus, of whom 87\u00a0are in intensive care and 49\u00a0are on a ventilator.", "The health department said a further 35\u00a0people were in ICU but their infections were no longer considered active.", "The seven-day average for hospitalisations has risen for the past nine days, from 296 on December 7 to 340 today.", "The new cases were detected from 80,841\u00a0test results received yesterday.", "There were 10,816\u00a0doses of vaccine administered at state-run sites yesterday, as well as more vaccinations at GP clinics and other venues.", "
Vaccination rules ease for non-essential retail
", "New public health orders announced yesterday have now come into effect in Victoria.", "People aged under 18\u00a0no longer have to show their vaccination status to get into any venues.", "Mandatory vaccination rules have also eased in most retail settings, meaning people\u00a0no longer have to present proof of being fully vaccinated against COVID-19.", "Proof of vaccination has also been dropped as a requirement in settings such as real estate, places of worship, weddings and funerals.", "Workers will still need to wear masks in hospitality settings, and both workers and customers will still need to wear masks in indoor retail settings.", "Opposition Leader Matthew Guy accused the government of \"changing the goal posts\" and called for mask rules to be removed as promised last month.", "The delay in lifting the mask rules has been attributed to concern over the new variant.", "
Push to vaccinate primary school students early next year
", "Victoria's Education Minister James Merlino said he hoped up to have up to 90 per cent of Victoria's five to 11-year-old's fully vaccinated by mid-2022.", "Access to COVID-19 vaccines will open up to children aged 5 to 11 in January, with the two doses scheduled to be given eight weeks apart.", "\"We want to get as many kids vaccinated as possible before we get to term 2 and start heading towards winter,\" Mr Merlino said.", "\"I'd love to see us getting to 90 per cent, [but] where we ultimately land is in the hands of parents and carers.\u00a0", "Mr Merlino said 94 per cent of schools had remained open for the entire period since students returned to face-to-face learning in term 4.", "\"I think our settings right now are working well,\" he said.\u00a0", "", "
Why we hear about some COVID-19 variants more than others
"]
